p: In the eucalyptus oil, GC-MS measurements show that the most abundant peak, eucalyptol, failed to elicit an antennal response from the BTM female antennae, indicating that the most abundant components are not essential to induce the oviposition deterrent effect ( Figure 3 and Figure 4). Eucalyptus oil is widely studied insect repellent [ 48], and it also showed an oviposition-deterrent effect against Plutella xylostella (L.) [ 49]. Although eucalyptol is a characteristic compound in eucalyptus oils and is used as a repellent against many insects [ 50], there was no detectable response towards it from BTM.
